Name: Advantica
Carrier_Description__c:
About Advantica

Advantica is a dedicated administrator of quality dental and vision plan benefits serving nearly 2,500 clients and close to 2.5 million members nationwide. At Advantica, we focus on improving the delivery of care through integrated and cost-effective ancillary benefit management, promoting health and wellness in the local community and maintaining a relentless focus on understanding and meeting customer needs.

Advantica works closely with our members, brokers, human resource managers and third party administrators by providing affordable, comprehensive vision and dental plans that are easy to implement and administer and backed by unparalleled, consumer-driven customer service.

The Advantica Advantage
Advantica offers expert 24/7 customer service and personalized account management support that is unparalleled in the industry today. Our systems are modern and our work habits and attitudes are old fashioned. Many brokers and clients tell us that we are a throwback to the past – when live people answered the telephone. We provide customer service with a smile as we delight in serving our clients. We invite you to experience The Advantica Advantage.


• Broad Network - Enjoy the freedom with our network of fully credentialed providers nationwide.
• Flexible Co-pay – We offer a variety of allowance and frequency options.
• Plan Options – Choose from employer sponsored or voluntary benefit plans.
• Rate Guarantees – Extended rate guarantees are available bundling Vision and Dental
• Convenience – With online enrollment, benefits administration, and provider locator capabilities.
• Personalized Service – Outstanding client management support and 24/7 customer service support.
• Accessibility – Dedicated toll free TTY/TDD telephone number for members with hearing or speech impairment
• Personalized Attention – Full-time enrollment/health fair and vision screening team.

Our Products
• Dental
• Vision

Please visit Advantica’s provider locator at www.advanticabenefits.com to find providers in your area.
For more information on Advantica products, please contact your local BenefitMall Sales Team.
Advantica is underwritten by National Guardian Life Insurance Company

Name: Aetna
Carrier_Description__c:
Aetna is one of the nation’s leading diversified health care benefits companies, offering a broad range of traditional and consumer-directed health insurance products and related services. By providing our members with information and resources to help them make better-informed decisions about their health care, we are creating a future where:

  • Members are fully engaged in their health and take responsibility for health care decisions.
  • The benefits experience members receive is personalized to meet their needs, based on experienced clinical knowledge and analysis.
  • All benefits seamlessly work together to enhance companies’ bottom lines and the well-being of their employees.

We design our innovative, client-centered health solutions to meet each employer’s needs. Contact your GA representative today to see what kind of unique benefits solutions we can create for your customers.

Name: Allied National
Carrier_Description__c:
Allied National is one of the oldest Third Party Administrators in the nation specializing in fully insured employer benefit plans.

Since 1970, Allied has been providing innovative solutions to agents and small employers seeking help in group insurance benefits. Allied has partnered with top insurance carriers to provide a full line of insurance plans covering health, dental, life and disability benefits.

From the unique Horizonsâ Cost Saver limited benefit plan to the flexible benefits and options of its Wellness Horizons family of traditional plans, Allied's group health plans are unmatched for the range of price and options that can fit into any employer's needs. 

Allied also offers unique group dental, life and disability plans with options and benefits that are not traditionally available to the small employer. 

Allied's 35+ years of experience as an innovator in small group insurance provides independent agents with a one stop source for all of their group insurance needs.

Name: AmeriHealth
Carrier_Description__c:
AmeriHealth offers quality health care products and services designed specifically to meet the changing health care needs of our customers. With access to hundreds of area hospitals and thousands of providers, AmeriHealth is a leader in employee health benefits in New Jersey, Delaware and Pennsylvania.

Consumer Driven Health Care
AmeriHealth recognizes the challenge that rising health care costs have created for businesses, and is committed to providing health coverage alternatives to better control costs. Our Consumer Driven Health Care products can lower premiums and more actively engage members in the health care decision-making process.

The cornerstone of AmeriHealth's Consumer Driven Heath Care strategy is our comprehensive product portfolio including AmeriHealth HMO, AmeriHealth POS, and AmeriHealth PPO.

AmeriHealth also offers an array of Health Account products including Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) and Health Reimbursement Accounts (HRA). These accounts can help offset increased member cost-sharing and provide a vehicle to save for medical expenses.

Consumer driven plans empower members to take responsibility for their health care decisions and share in controlling costs. Our Connections Health Management Programs provide access to important resources such as health coaches and educational materials to help our members make informed health care decisions. Through amerihealthexpress.com, our secure, online portal, members can manage their health accounts online. Informed members become better consumers of health care.

AmeriHealth Healthy LifestylesSM
Resources for your well being.
AmeriHealth's wellness programs help members lead healthier lives and make better choices.

AmeriHealth Healthy Lifestyles Programs - Our Healthy Lifestyles wellness programs are designed to educate and encourage healthy behavior through active participation.

*Most members have a variety of programs available to them including:

  • Fitness Clubs Reimbursement
  • Weight Management Reimbursement
  • Smoking Cessation Reimbursement
  • Baby BluePrintsSM Maternity Program
  • Alternative Health Services

Connections Health Management Programs - Provide members with information and support they need to take an active role in their health care. From answering questions about treating a bee sting to helping members handle chronic conditions such as asthma or diabetes, our Connections Health Management Programs have something for everyone.

Connections provides:

  • Access to Health Coaches 24/7
  • Member Outreach
  • Health Education and reminders
  • Healthwise® Knowledgebase Information Encyclopedia

Online Account Management - amerihealthexpressSM
Simple. Safe. Secure.
Through amerihealthexpress.com members and groups can safely and conveniently manage their health care coverage online. Registration is quick and simple - and transactions are secure.

For members
Members of an AmeriHealth health benefits plan can access personal and family coverage information. amerihealthexpress can also be personalized to show health-related content of greater interest to the members.

  • Access your specific benefit information
  • View claims
  • Download forms
  • Request materials
  • Reconcile invoices

For groups
A group administrator or business owner offering AmeriHealth health benefits plans can access information about the group's account.

  • View current and prior invoices
  • Make payments online
  • Submit changes
  • View coverage history
  • Manage member accounts

Awards & Recognition
AmeriHealth has been recognized by national organizations and publications for the quality of our health plans and for employment-related accomplishments.

AmeriHealth HMO - highest designation of "Excellent"
AmeriHealth HMO received the highest designation of "Excellent" from the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA), a leading organization monitoring the HMO industry.

100 Best Places to Work
AmeriHealth New Jersey was named one of the 100 Best Places to Work in New Jersey in 2004 by a consortium of state and civic agencies.

Carrier_Description__c:
Ameritas is one of the leading providers of quality dental and vision products and services. Established in 1887, Ameritas offers more than a century of insurance industry expertise and superior customer service.

 

Ameritas makes your job easier with:

·         Expansive network

Want to learn more? Contact your local Ameritas sales representative.

Name: Anthem
Carrier_Description__c:
Background
Since its founding over 65 years ago, the company has grown into a leading provider of health plans and benefit services under the respected Blue Cross® and Blue Shield® brands. The Blues have been a historical leader in its markets and one of the oldest health plans serving the Rocky Mountain Region. The company provides health coverage to more than one million people in Colorado and Nevada through its Preferred Provider Organization (PPO), Health Maintenance Organization (HMO), Point of Service (POS) and Indemnity health plans. The mission of Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield is “To improve the health of the people we serve.”

Premier Benefits and the Nation’s Largest Network
Convenience, access, seamless administration — what your employees want, they get with Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield’s PPO health benefit program. Because Anthem is a member of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association,* Anthem PPO members access care through the BlueCard® program. That means a dedicated claims processing system and a cross-country network linking 90 percent of doctors and 80 percent of hospitals in America. 

Corporate Alliance
Anthem’s parent company is an Indiana-domiciled publicly traded company that, through its subsidiary companies, provides health care benefits and services to approximately 28 million people. Anthem’s parent company, which is based in Indianapolis, is the Blue Cross licensee in California and the Blue Cross and Blue Shield licensee in 12 other states:  Colorado, Connecticut Georgia, Indiana, Kentucky, Maine, Missouri (excluding 30 counties in the Kansas City area), Nevada, New Hampshire, Ohio, and Virginia (excluding the immediate suburbs of Washington, D.C. More information about Anthem is available at www.anthem.com.

Anthem Overview
Anthem evolved in the mid 1990’s following the merger of The Associated Group of Kentucky and Indiana, and the Community Mutual Insurance Company in Ohio. This merger was the nation's first multi-state integrated health care system. In late 1997, the company established a second operating region, Anthem East, when it acquired Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Connecticut. In 1999, Anthem strengthened its presence in this region by announcing its intent to purchase Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Maine and completing the acquisition of Blue Cross and Blue Shield of New Hampshire in October. A month later, Anthem added Blue Cross Blue Shield of Colorado and Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nevada, thereby establishing Anthem’s third operating region known as Anthem West. On July 31, 2002, Anthem completed the merger with Trigon Blue Cross and Blue Shield in Virginia, establishing a Southeast operating region. On November 30, 2004, Anthem, Inc. merged with the parent company of Blue Cross of California, making the combined companies the largest health coverage carrier in the United States.

Managed care continues to increase in importance in health care today. Anthem’s managed care mission is quite clear. As a manager of health care networks, Anthem pursues partnerships with leading physicians and hospitals, while striving for continual quality improvement through clinical management and the collection, interpretation and sharing of accurate information with providers and customers. Anthem’s strategy of building partnerships with exceptional physicians and hospitals allows it to deliver consistent quality and cost management to employers within Anthem’s service areas. Anthem’s affiliation with Blue Cross and Blue Shield Plans nationally gives it the ability to serve employees outside the region served by Anthem.

Financial Stability
Anthem’s parent company is a Fortune 500 company. The insurance industry’s most respected rating agencies continue to recognize Anthem’s financial strength.

AM Best = A              

Fitch = AA-                  

Standard & Poors = A  

Moody's = A1        

NCQA Accreditation
In September 2004, Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield; subsidiary company, HMO Colorado, Inc., once again earned an Excellent accreditation status – the highest level awarded – from the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA). The NCQA Excellent rating applies to the health maintenance organization (HMO) and point-of-service (POS) plans in Colorado. This designation signifies that HMO Colorado’s performance meets the most stringent quality standards in the industry. In December 2004, Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield became URAC accredited in Utilization Management for its HMO and PPO operations in Colorado and Nevada.

Customer Choice
Employers look to the company and its subsidiaries for choices that meet varied and unique needs:

Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) HMO Colorado provides two delivery systems connecting its provider network to members. The first is through Primary Care Physicians (PCPs) who contract directly. Though the HMO network is open access, these PCPs still manage a member’s care.

Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) PPO’s give cost-effective choices from one of the largest provider networks in the Colorado offering the member choice. The PPO is a non-gatekeeper product.

Indemnity Coverage Some customers still look for traditional health coverage. At Anthem, traditional coverage has always been delivered through a broad network of participating physicians, hospitals and other providers.

Administrative Services Many customers look to Anthem for efficient, flexible and reliable administrative support of benefit plans that are underwritten and financed by major purchasers. These include, but not limited to, dental, disability or workers’ compensation coverage.

Individual Plans Anthem also serves individuals and others not covered by employer groups in Colorado. One of the most successful is the health-care coverage the company provides to children who do not receive cost-effective coverage under their parents or guardians health plans. The Blues brand symbolizes security for many of the people purchasing individual coverage.

Comprehensive Solutions Finally, with an already-broad product mix, the company can tailor its offerings to meet unique needs. It can analyze a customer’s benefit requirements and offer a comprehensive solution. For example, Anthem can coordinate HMO and POS health plans with disability coverage to give an affordable and complete solution. As the company marshals the varied elements of its product mix, and as it delivers customized solutions, Anthem has become a better partner to customers. In all markets, the Blues brand is a competitive advantage.

Ancillary Products
The most trusted name in health care also offers dental coverage, plus a full range of term life, disability and voluntary insurance products, flexible benefit plans and third party claims administration to complete your benefits package.

Anthem Dental
Anthem Dental offers a statewide dental plan in both Colorado and Nevada. Anthem Dental has placed a strong emphasis on the creating a strong and stable provider network with flexible benefit designs to meet the client’s needs. Additional information is available on the Anthem website at www.anthem.com. 

Term Life, Disability and AD&D Products
Anthem Life, a subsidiary of Anthem, has been serving policyholders for 25 years.

  • Group Term Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance
  • Short-term Disability Insurance
  • Long-term Disability Insurance 

Voluntary Group Products
A voluntary insurance program from Anthem Life gives employees access to a customized life and disability package through convenient payroll deductions, with no added premium cost to your company.

  • Voluntary Group Term Life Insurance
  • Voluntary Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance
  • Voluntary Short-term Disability Insurance 

Flexible Benefit Plans
Anthem has formed a strategic relationship with FlexBen Corporation for the provision of IRS Section 125 Flexible Benefit plan services to its own employees and its clients. FlexBen Corporation is the nation's leading independent provider of Flexible Benefit plan consulting, administration and related services.

Benefit plans offered by FlexBen include:

  • Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare and Dependent Care Reimbursement)
  • Premium Conversion Plans
  • Cafeteria Plans

Anthem Vision
Anthem now offers a more comprehensive vision product to meet the needs of today’s client. The vision product offers an array of benefits with different copays and co-insurance. Below are some highlights of the new vision product:

  • A national network of 24,000 providers, including all LensCrafters locations.
  • Competitive premiums at least 10 percent lower than our competitors’
  • Benefit design options to meet the needs of the small or large group client including fully insured, self-funded or voluntary plan
  • Preferred pricing for eyewear, contact lenses and more

Anthem Healthy Solutions
Anthem Health Solutions is a series of programs designed to support informed patient decision making, maintain healthcare costs, and collaborate with hospitals and physicians to improve the quality and safety of healthcare. It includes a wide variety of programs and services designed to keep your employees healthy and productive through:

  • Informed Solutions – resources that educate and empower through resources such as Anthem.com
  • Guided Solutions – pointing your employees who may need a little extra support toward better health such as disease management and health education programs
  • Targeted Solutions – programs designed to take aim at serious health conditions by providing added support to those who need it.

Online Capabilities
Anthem’s website is an integral part of Anthem’s Health Solutions. The anthem website offers member utilities, and a variety or programs and services that educate and inform. Anthem.com has all the basics that members need, such as products, services and contact information, while offering 24/7 access to personalized plan information and self-service tools.

Members have a wealth of information available at anthem.com.

MyAnthem, a personalized member website link allows members to choose/change PCPs, check claims status, visit the Online Pharmacy to refill prescriptions, request a replacement ID card, search for a provider and obtain driving directions to that provider location, and select hospitals based on reputation or clinical outcomes.

Anthem has added MyHealth@Anthem, which supplies members with personalized health information, self-care centers and health management tools.

SpecialOffers@Anthem is a discount program that offers employees impressive savings on health-related products and services.
 
Members can also email customer service through the Anthem website at anthem.com.

Name: Apex
Carrier_Description__c:
Apex Management Group offers industry-leading products because of the established partnerships the company has within the insurance industry.  Our proprietary actuarial model gives Apex management the freedom to offer innovative plan designs with an unparalleled 4-year rate lock.  All Apex MEC products are reinsured by Swiss Re. 

Each of the APEX plan designs exceed the Minimum Essential Coverage (MEC) requirements employers are required to meet, in order to avoid Penalty A under PPACA (“Obamacare”).

When an employer chooses the Apex MEC Plus Advantage plan, their employees receive:
• TELADOC 24/7 (Multilingual)
• Pharmacy Benefits (Welldyne Rx)
• Preventative Care Visits (Unlimited)
• Primary Care Visits (3 per plan year)
• Specialists Visits (3 per plan year)
• Urgent Care Visits (3 per plan year)
• MRI and CT Scan Benefits (max 1 CT or MRI per plan year)
• X-ray and Lab Benefits (5 per plan year)
• MultiPlan / PHCS Network
• Swiss Re / Reinsurer

Additional Information:
• Guaranteed issued product
• Minimum group size of 4 employees, no participation requirements
• All of our plans can be sold alongside most major medical and voluntary carriers nationwide
• Apex has ULLICO members (Taft Hartley Act program) enrolled
• COBRA services are included in the premium
• Employer can contribute 0% - 100% of premium

Name: ArmadaCare
Carrier_Description__c:
About ArmadaCare

A healthcare and insurance services company headquartered in Hunt Valley, MD, ArmadaCare develops, manages and distributes proprietary specialty insurance products to brokers and their clients and in collaboration with premier insurance carriers. ArmadaCare is known for maintaining world-class client service standards. ArmadaCare’s premier product is Ultimate Health, an employer-paid supplemental healthcare reimbursement plan. An ACA-Excepted Benefit, Ultimate Health can be offered to select employee classes. Ultimate Health combines a robust medical reimbursement insurance plan with a strategic health and wellness program designed to keep a company’s top performers healthy, productive and focused.

How Can Ultimate Health Help You as a Consultant?
This plan can help you:
  • Gain more frequent access to the decision-maker because this product gets the attention of the company C-suite. Once that door is opened, it’s an opportunity to introduce additional lines of coverage.
  • Differentiate yourself from the competition to land new accounts.
  • Solve coverage issues, such as network limitations and changes to the Rx formulary, which helps clients from becoming frustrated.
  • Retain clients since happier clients tend to renew year after year; plus those who buy Ultimate Health tend to remain on the plan for a long time.

www.armadacare.com

www.ultimatehealth.com

Name: Avesis
Carrier_Description__c:
Avesis offers a full array of vision care plans tailored to meet the needs of a diversified healthcare employee benefits market. Our vision care product lines include stand-alone fully insured programs, ASO contracts, discount plans and turn-key, Private Label solutions.

Avesis is a licensed third party administrator, Preferred Provider Organization and insurance company.

History
Founded in 1978 as NVS, (National Vision Services), we have been refining our business of delivering premium vision care services at substantial discounts and savings to our sponsors and members. Today, we cover more than 2,000,000 members in 50 states and Puerto Rico.

Locations
Headquartered in Phoenix, Arizona Avesis has regional offices in:

  • Georgia
  • Illinois
  • Iowa
  • Maryland
  • Massachusetts
  • Minnesota
  • Texas

Underwriter Partners
Fully insured products are underwritten by:

  • Fidelity Security Life Insurance Company
  • Avesis Insurance Incorporated (in Arizona only) 

Clients
Avesis' clients consist of thousands of employers, unions, insurance carriers, BlueCross/BlueShield organizations, TPA's and associations.

Our larger clients include:

  • BlueCross BlueShield of Arizona
  • BlueCross BlueShield of Georgia
  • Kaiser Permanente of Georgia
  • Coventry of North Carolina
  • State of Arizona Employees
  • DentaQuest

Provider Network
Over 18,000 carefully selected, screened and credentialed providers at over 10,000 locations nationwide.

Approximately 68% of our network consists of independent providers. Remaining 32% consist of national and regional chain providers.

How are we different from our competition?
Avesis offers unique plan options designed to fit the need of any size organization. We currently offer vision benefits to groups with as few as 5 participants.

Name: AvMed
Carrier_Description__c:
Quality and Service

AvMed has been serving members throughout Florida for more than 40 years and we are truly dedicated to making high-quality health coverage more available and affordable for a new generation of Floridians.

AvMed ranks highest in member satisfaction among commercial health plans in Florida, according to J.D. Power and Associates.*

AvMed is consistently recognized for service excellence. Once again, AvMed Health Plans received the highest overall member satisfaction rating of any statewide Florida plan submitting data to the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA).**

The NCQA, the nation's top health care quality evaluator, also accredited AvMed's Commercial and Medicare products as "Excellent," a distinction shared only by a select group of health plans in the country

AvMed's focus on service is appreciated by clients, many who have been with us for more than 10 years, giving employers the reassurance of knowing we will be there when they need us

AvMed channels its not-for-profit earnings into continually improving services for members. Our members have easy access to a robust network of doctors, hospitals and specialists to meet all of their health care needs. AvMed also provides a high level of personalized service, setting the standard for excellence in the industry for our members. AvMed’s Online Consumer Tools provide members the resources they need to become educated, cost-conscious health care consumers.

The Health Plan of Choice

AvMed offers a variety of HMO and Self-Funded (ASO) products to large and small employer groups throughout Florida. AvMed’s ASO programs offer a plan that effectively controls cost to help the self-funded employer. In South Florida, AvMed provides coverage to individuals and families as well as Medicare Advantage to seniors.

Partners for a Healthy Lifestyle

AvMed provides members the tools and support to live a healthy, more productive life. Incentive programs range from reimbursements for Weight Watchers® to nutritional counseling. For members with chronic conditions, our team of registered nurses offers individualized attention and educational information to help members manage their health and make positive lifestyle choices.

As the health plan with your health in mind, it is our goal to keep our members active and healthy. It is also our charge to make health care easy for our members and we make every effort to fulfill that pledge.

*AvMed Health Plans received the highest numerical score among commercial health plans in the Florida region in the proprietary J.D. Power and Associates 2012 U.S. Member Health Plan Studysm. Study based on 32,868 total member responses, measuring six plans in the Florida Region (excludes Medicare and Medicaid). Proprietary study results are based on experiences and perceptions of members surveyed December 2011-January 2012. Your experiences may vary. Visit jdpower.com.

**Highest overall rating of statewide plans reporting Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) and Point of Service (POS) product data to the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) for the Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems (CAHPS). CAHPS® is a registered trademark of the Agency of Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)

 Note: All services may not be available in all states for this carrier. View state grid for details.

Name: Blue Cross Blue Shield Florida
Carrier_Description__c:
About Us
The stability and strength of our health care coverage is one way we provide confidence to Floridians. But we also provide hope. Through The Blue Foundation for a Healthy Florida, we provide grants to organizations focused on improving health in our communities. And, through BlueCommunity Champions, our employees dedicate their efforts to causes throughout the state. We also provide jobs. Our home office is in Jacksonville, but we employ thousands throughout our state.

History
We have a long history of providing health-related solutions to the people of Florida. Our roots date back to 1944. Ever since then, we continue to grow and expand.

Today, our focus remains primarily in the health industry, but BCBSF is more than a health insurer. In response to a vastly changing marketplace, we are involved with companies to meet the diverse needs of the health industry overall.

Our Relationship with the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association
We are an independent licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association (Association). The Association governs the business practices of approximately 42 independent plans located nationwide and in Puerto Rico.

We all rely on the Association to be our collective voice in the federal and state legislatures with the purpose of bringing meaningful changes and advances to the U.S. health care financing and delivery system.

Collectively, Blue Cross and Blue Shield plans provide health care coverage for 88.7 million - or more than one in three - Americans.1

Health is offered by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Florida, Inc. (BCBSF). Dental, Life and Disability are offered by Florida Combined Life, Inc., an affiliate of BCBSF.  All companies are Independent Licensees of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association.

1Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, June 2003

Name: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Georgia
Carrier_Description__c:
Blue Cross Blue Shield of Georgia is recognized as a leader in the health insurance industry. We are the largest health care coverage provider in Georgia. Our commitment to providing quality coverage and a high level of customer service has earned the trust of Georgians.

Blue Cross Blue Shield of Georgia has consistently served the health care needs of Georgians since the 1930’s. Known for its stability and endurance in an ever-changing and challenging marketplace, the Georgia Blue plan is a trusted health care leader throughout the state. Blue Cross Blue Shield of Georgia together with its branded affiliates provides health care services to more than 3.3 million members. The original entity, the Atlanta Blue Cross Plan, was founded in 1937. Shortly thereafter, in 1939, the Savannah Plan was formed, followed by the Columbus Plan in 1946. Through a merger in 1966 of the Columbus and Savannah plans, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Georgia/Columbus was realized. The Columbus and Atlanta organizations merged in 1985 to form Blue Cross Blue Shield of Georgia.

To learn more about Anthem’s senior products, please contact your BenefitMall Senior Sales Team.

Name: Blue Cross Blue Shield of TX
Carrier_Description__c:
Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Texas knows health care coverage in Texas; we invented it. We’re Texas born and bred, and this is the only place we do business. Our mission since our founding more than 70 years ago has been to provide financially sound health care coverage to as many Texans as possible.

  • We serve more than 4 million members in all 254 Texas counties. 
  • We serve some of the best known Texas companies, including Brinker International, Brookshire Grocery, the City of Houston, Continental    Airlines, the Employees Retirement System of Texas, Halliburton, H.E.B. Grocery, Pilgrim's Pride, the Teacher Retirement System of Texas, the Texas A&M System, Texas Instruments, TXU and The University of Texas System. 
  • We maintain our state headquarters in Richardson, with regional headquarters in Houston, Austin and Lubbock. 
  • We process our members’ claims in Texas in our claims and customer service facilities in Abilene, Houston, Marshall, Richardson, San Angelo, Waco and Wichita Falls.

We’re a non-investor-owned health insurance company -- the only one serving every corner of the state. We believe Texas consumers and employers deserve the best of both worlds -- access to affordable, quality health care and top-notch service from a company that focuses solely on customers, not shareholders. Customer value is our cornerstone.

We have a special relationship with physicians and hospitals that dates back to 1929. We remain committed to partnering with physicians and hospitals to provide access to affordable, quality health care, and we are a collaborative partner seeking solutions to joint concerns with employers, physicians, hospitals and governmental bodies. Our health care provider network is the largest in the state, with more than 36,000 physicians and 400 hospitals across Texas.

Because of this unique commitment, we’re able to provide a wide array of health benefit solutions through a variety of products which include both Individual family coverage and Small Group offerings.

We have a deep commitment to meeting the health coverage needs of our Texas customers; a local matter that we believe is best served by a company with local roots.

Blue Cross Blue Shield of Texas is underwritten by Health Care Service Corporation.

Name: BEST Life and Health Insurance Company
Carrier_Description__c:
BEST LIFE has been providing group medical, dental, long-term disability, vision and life insurance to employers since 1970. Today, we’re a mid-sized carrier with contracted agents licensed throughout the country. We continue to expand our presence, our products and our markets.

BEST LIFE has built its reputation by providing service to our agents and their clients that cannot be duplicated by any competitor.

 

What makes BEST LIFE different is what makes us great!

  • Personal attention and customer service
  • Online dental quoting available 24 hours a day
  • Customizable sales tools to support your marketing 
  • Access to national PPO networks
  • Poducts tailored to meet your clients needs
  • Simplified underwriting processing
  • Quick claims turnaround
  • Sophisticated claims system Financial stability, strength and demonstrated market commitment


Dental Plans

BEST LIFE has a variety of dental products to suit almost any need.

  • Indemnity Dental Plans (Passive PPO Network)
  • PPO Dental Plans
  • Voluntary Dental Plans
  • Large Group Dental Plans

Please refer to http://www.besthealthplans.com for a complete list of quoting requirements.

 

Medical Plans
We offer a wide selection of medical plan options – choose the between low and high deductible plans, plans with higher yearly maximums and higher or lower network benefits.

 

Vision Plans
Vision care insurance from BEST LIFE covers regular eye exams, as well as glasses and contact lenses.

 

Group Term Life and Portable Life

We have two options for life coverage – Essential Group Term Life and our completely portable and voluntary life product, Passport.

Name: Block Vision
Carrier_Description__c:
Block Vision is a specialty health-benefits company that manages all levels of vision and eye care benefits. Block Vision has been managing vision benefit plans for more than 20 years and currently serves over 4.5 million members nationwide.

What Block Vision is All About…

  • Competitive Pricing
  • Focused exclusively on vision benefits
  • Plan flexibility to meet your clients’ needs
  • Full Service Benefits (not a discount program)
  • Easy to use Co-pay Plan vs. reimbursement plan (tedious claim filing

Service, Value, and Choice….
You can select from a variety of plan options, including:

  • Full-Service Plans
  • Eyewear-Only Plans
  • Exam-Only Plans
  • Employer-Paid Plans
  • Voluntary Plans

We also offer a variety of plan design options, with the ability to select:

  • Benefit Frequency
  • Eyeglass frame and contact lens benefit allowances
  • Copayments for eye examinations and/or eyewear
  • Laser Vision Correction (e.g. LASIK) benefit allowances in lieu of eyeglasses where available

Block Vision Plan Advantages*

  • Diverse provider panel that includes private practitioners AND retail optical centers, including Wal-Mart Vision Centers and Sam’s Club, just to name a few.
  • Freedom of Choice in Eyewear Selection
    Retail Centers+ Private Practitioners = Larger Frame Selection
  • Unlike many vision plans, Block Vision does not require its participating providers to order eyeglass lenses from a designated ophthalmic laboratory.
    Freedom of Choice in Optical Labs = Quicker Turnaround Time for Glasses

More Support, More Services

  • More comprehensive plan, competitive price
  • Easy Implementation / Easy To Use
  • One page group application
  • Census enrollment
  • On-line administrative tools
  • Personalized open enrollment support and quick, easy implementation
  • Convenient toll-free member service support
  • Easy to quote on HealthConnect

Excellent Benefits and Excellent Services....That’s Block Vision!!
Participation Requirements:

  • Employer-Paid Plans- Requirement of 50% or more contribution from the employer and enrollment of 5 or more employees and 75% participation

Name: CaliforniaChoice
Carrier_Description__c:
The healthcare needs of each individual are personal and varied; a plan that works well for one member of the family might not address the needs of others. Specific doctors, prescriptions and financial limitations drive these considerations; however the system for healthcare benefits is not always well equipped to address them.

In 1996, CaliforniaChoice® introduced a new and effective way to meet the changing needs of employees at small California companies; while offering an effective program that would enable business owners to continue subsidizing benefits in the face of rising healthcare premiums.

The concept, known as a Defined Contribution Exchange, offers a solution that gives employers the advantage of cost control while achieving a higher level of employee retention through satisfaction. Employees can choose the health plan attributes that specifically fit their needs.

  • Carrier selection
  • Premium/benefit level
  • Doctor network
  • Formulary
  • Voluntary vs. buy-up options

Our Core Offerings

CaliforniaChoice offers medical HMO, HSA and PPO plans; dental HMO, PPO and EPO; Rx; voluntary vision and multi-choice dental coverage; term life; chiropractic/acupuncture options. Our list of premier carriers include:

Health Plans

  • Anthem Blue Cross (HMO and PPO)
  • Health Net, Elect Open Access, Salud HMO y mas and Salud Mexico
  • Kaiser Permanente
  • Sharp Health Plan
  • Western Health Advantage

Ancillary Plans

  • Ameritas Group - Dental
  • EyeMed – Vision
  • Landmark Healthcare – Chiro/Acupuncture
  • Assurity Life Insurance – Term Life
  • SmileSaver – Dental

Advantages for Our Partners and Customers

EmployerAdvantages

  • Exceptional cost control
  • Guaranteed rates for 12 months
  • Full choice program offering 5 health plans and formulary options, and extensive provider networks
  • Simple and efficient online administration
  • Single source billing
  • Full team support from enrollment through renewal
  • Highly effective recruitment and retention tool

Broker/Consultant Advantages

  • Best selling healthcare benefits program available to small groups in California
  • Level 7% commissions on medical and chiropractic; Level 12% commissions on dental and vision
  • Improved client retention
  • Complete sales, marketing and implementation support like none other in the business

Employee Advantages

  • The freedom to choose the healthcare that suits their individual needs
  • Larger doctor network
  • Enhanced formulary options
  • The ability to access and update plan information, conduct doctor/hospital search and order forms 24/7 via our secure website

Carrier Advantages

  • Increase brand awareness
  • Reduced administrative tasks and costs through automation and customer support
  • Additional marketing channel

Name: CareFirst Blue Cross Blue Shield

CareFirst is the largest health care insurer in the Mid-Atlantic region, serving more than 3 million members

Has more than 80 percent of all of the Maryland/D.C./Delaware/Northern Virginia region's health care providers participating in one or more of its provider networks

Name: Cigna
Carrier_Description__c:
Cigna HealthCare: Improve health.

Businesses face a big decision. How can they provide their employees with a health plan that’s affordable, yet doesn’t skimp on the programs and services that help improve health?

Cigna has a track record of results when it comes to helping people get healthy and stay healthy. Plus, some of the most innovative plan designs available. Behind it all are the solid qualities and programs you’re looking for.

Improving health. That’s the goal. Cigna offers several benefits designed to give our members a healthy advantage and are included at no additional cost with our fully insured plans.

Cigna Well Aware for Better Health®.
At no additional cost, this award-winning disease management solution gives members access to support and education. Trained clinicians are in touch to help them manage their health and follow physicians’ care plans.

Healthy Rewards®.
Through this program, members can save money on health and wellness services not usually covered by traditional plans*. Programs include:

  • Weight management and nutrition
  • Tobacco cessation
  • Acupuncture
  • Laser vision correction
  • Fitness club memberships, and
  • Mayo Clinic books

Cigna Tel-Drug Home Delivery Pharmacy.
High-quality prescription medications are delivered to members’ homes through this convenient plan.

myCigna.com.
This secure member website is a fast, convenient way to find a physician. Track a claim.  And use the latest tools to research diseases, as well as compare hospitals and prescription medications. Here’s what members find online:

HealthQuotientTM Health Risk Assessment.
This brief, confidential questionnaire can help members identify and monitor their health status. Members who complete it receive recommendations to help them stay well, plus links to other interactive tools

Prescription Price Quote Tool.
Allows members to check the costs of their prescriptions, and generic equivalents if available, by specific pharmacy and location (including Cigna Tel-Drug), based on their individual plan.

DrugCompareTM.
Learn about and compare drug treatment options for more than 200 common medications.  And evaluate up to 10 medications at once to better understand side effects and drug interactions.

Health Record, a secure, centralized source of personal information. Members can input their current conditions, medications, allergies, surgeries, immunizations and personal contact information in case of an emergency.

Easy-to-read charts from Health Tracker. Members can use them to monitor key health measurements like blood pressure, blood sugar, cholesterol, height and weight.

Healthwise®.
An interactive library with the latest on a wide range of health topics, including specific illnesses, first aid and medical exams.

Condition Centers®.
The place to start for facts on the prevention and treatment of more than 39 conditions, with links to related Cigna HealthCare programs.

Select Quality CareTM Hospital Comparison Tool. Learn how hospitals rank by number of procedures performed, average length of stay and cost. 
 
*Some Healthy Rewards programs are not available in all states. If your Cigna HealthCare plan includes coverage for any of these services, this program is in addition to, not instead of, your plan benefits. Healthy Rewards programs are separate from your medical benefits. A discount program is NOT insurance, and the member must pay the entire discounted charge.
 
“Cigna” and ”Cigna HealthCare” refer to various operating subsidiaries of Cigna Corporation. Products and services are provided by these subsidiaries and not by Cigna Corporation. These subsidiaries include Connecticut General Life Insurance Company, Tel-Drug, Inc. and its affiliates, Cigna Behavioral Health, Inc., Intracorp, and HMO or service company subsidiaries of Cigna Health Corporation and Cigna Dental Health, Inc. In Arizona, HMO plans are offered by Cigna HealthCare of Arizona, Inc. In California, HMO plans are offered by Cigna HealthCare of California, Inc. IN Virginia, HMO plans are offered by Cigna HealthCare of Virginia, Inc. and Cigna HealthCare Mid-Atlantic, Inc. In North Carolina, HMO plans are offered by Cigna HealthCare of North Carolina, Inc. All other medical plans in these states are insured or administered by Connecticut General Life Insurance Company.

Name: Connecticare
Carrier_Description__c:
Ranked as one of the top health plans in America, ConnectiCare prides itself on being a company with superior customer service.

We have been providing managed care services to our members since 1982 and have consistently met exceptionally high standards in many areas, including customer satisfaction and quality of service. ConnectiCare maintains a fully-credentialed quality network access area that covers all of Connecticut as well as adjacent counties in neighboring states: Hampden, Hampshire, Franklin and portions of Berkshire counties in western Massachusetts; and the metro New York area including the five boroughs of New York City, Westchester, Putnam, Orange, and Rockland counties. Members have an in-network choice of more than 21,000 fully credentialed health care providers and 127 acute care hospitals, including all Connecticut hospitals.

Our corporate mission is simple — to improve the health status of our members. Our success, accomplishments and commitment to providing such quality managed care is fully substantiated by the following measures:

  • Best in Customer Complaints - The Connecticut Insurance Department releases annual rankings on customer complaints. ConnectiCare was ranked number 1 for having the least number of complaints of all health plans in Connecticut. This is the 3rd consecutive year in a row for ConnectiCare to earn this top honor.
  • One of the Highest Ranked Health Plans in America - According to the magazine’s annual health plan rankings, U.S. News & World Report with the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) has consistently ranked ConnectiCare among the top health plans in the nation. In fact, ConnectiCare was ranked sixth in the nation in 2005 and 2006, fifth in 2007, and thirteenth in 2008. Over 250 plans are evaluated for this ranking.
  •  Customer Service - ConnectiCare earned the highest member satisfaction score for customer service of any health plan in Connecticut - according to the 2008 Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems Survey (CAHPS), the most widely used benchmark for health plans.
  • National Accreditation - ConnectiCare’s quality have been recognized by our industry’s toughest critic, the NCQA. NCQA is a private, not-for-profit organization that accredits health plans based on a rigorous and comprehensive evaluation process. Since 1997, ConnectiCare has had full accreditation from NCQA. In 1999, ConnectiCare was recognized for superior quality and service by being granted an “Excellent” accreditation status and maintains this status today. During the latest accreditation, ConnectiCare also received distinction in Member Connections, Care Management, and Health Improvements.
  • Disease Management - Health Industries Research Companies (HIRC) named ConnectiCare to its top selection of 2005 Leading Disease Management Organizations. Only 23 health plans, 5% of health plans nationally, received this designation. In addition, ConnectiCare is the first health plan with in-house programs to earn the HIRC distinction and the Disease Management Purchasing Consortium (DMPC) Savings Certification.
  • Recognition for Service and Training - ConnectiCare received the “Excellence in Practice” Award from the American Society for Training and Development (ASTD) for its innovative customer service program “The Royal Treatment.” Only twelve organizations internationally have been selected for “Excellence in Practice” top honors. Others companies competing in the international contest for the top honor included companies such as FEDEX, Daimler Chrysler Motors Company, Ford Motor Company, and Hewlett-Packard Company.
  • Quality Improvement - ConnectiCare is an eight-time winner of the Connecticut Quality Improvement Award (CQIA). ConnectiCare has received gold and silver awards for managing disease and improving patient care quality.

Name: Dearborn National
Carrier_Description__c:
About Dearborn National™
Dearborn National offers a broad selection of highly competitive insurance and financial products covering diverse markets, including: Group Benefits (employer-paid/voluntary), Worksite and Individual Solutions, as well as an array of value-added services.

We serve groups and individuals, including some of the largest companies and most recognized names in the United States. We also offer the largest Dental PPO Network in the U.S. with more than 160,000 dental access points and are among the leading providers of group insurance benefits in the United States. In fact, we rank second for total number of Group Life contracts in force1, and provide coverage to more than eight million insureds.

Combined, our companies boast:

  • Total annual net revenues of nearly $1.4 billion
  • Total assets of nearly $3.7 billion
  • Shareholder's Equity of more than $670 million
  • More than 40 years of industry experience

Our parent company, Health Care Service Corporation, a Mutual Legal Reserve Company, (HCSC) is the largest non-investor owned health care insurance provider in the United States and the fourth largest overall.

We Are Everywhere
The Dearborn National brand companies are licensed in all 50 states, as well as the District of Columbia, the U.S. Virgin Islands, the British Virgin Islands, Guam and Puerto Rico. Across the nation, we have more than 30 administrative and sales offices providing service and support to our producers and members. We also have an international presence as the exclusive U.S. member of the Swiss Life Network, providing employee benefits to multinational employers.

We Uphold Values That Set Us Apart
Our values differentiate us from our competitors and help define the way we do business.

  • Strength. We are financially strong and capable of fulfilling our promises. The bottom line is that we maintain a strong balance sheet backed by conservative investment polices to ensure we are able to fulfill our commitments.
  • Independence. Today, many insurance companies are publicly traded stock companies that must satisfy the demands of their institutional stockholders and analysts. Dearborn National is privately held, which means our purpose and our objectives will always focus on offering products and services that are in the best interest of our customers.
  • Solutions. It is not acceptable to provide one-size-fits-all products and services. As a matter of principle, we believe in providing solutions of the highest caliber, because a first-rate product is the only thing good enough for our customers. That’s why we continually re-evaluate our products and services to make sure we are meeting the needs of each of our clients and offering the solutions that work best for them. We build relationships in which we listen to our customers and provide big-company solutions with a small-company touch.

For more information visit us at www.dearbornnational.com.

1 Based on results shown in LIMRA’s Group Life Sales and In Force 2008 Annual Results.

© 2010 Dearborn National brand companies. All Rights Reserved.
Products and services marketed under the Dearborn National™ brand and the star logo are underwritten and/or provided by the following companies: Fort Dearborn Life Insurance Company® (Downers Grove, Illinois), Fort Dearborn Life Insurance Company® of New York (Pittsford, New York) and Colorado Bankers Life Insurance Company® (Greenwood Village, Colorado). Product features and availability vary by state and company, and are solely the responsibility of each affiliate.

Name: Delta Dental
Carrier_Description__c:
Delta Dental offers a variety of programs aimed at managing costs for companies of all sizes. We offer a wide range of plans that provide enrollees with broad access to dentists, including managed fee-for-service, preferred provider organization (PPO) and dental HMO plans. Our fee-for-service and PPO plans feature The Delta Difference® - built-in cost management and quality of care mechanisms designed to protect enrollees from:

  • Charges greater than the amount defined by Delta as the patient’s covered benefit;
  • Unnecessary paperwork – Delta dentists file claims for their patients and are paid directly by us;
  • Unprofessional standards of hygiene, radiation safety and other areas related to quality of care;
  • Unnecessary dental services;
  • Fraud – Delta works with government regulators and law enforcement agencies to curb program abuse.

Delta Dental Premier – the nation’s largest fee-for-service dental plan. In California, 91 percent of dentists participate in the Premier network, and there is a statewide enrollment of 3.2 million. Our nationwide network encompasses 152,000 dental office locations, the largest network in the country. This program features:

  • Freedom to choose any dentist (with lower out-of-pocket costs when visiting a Delta dentist);
  • No balance billing – dentists accept Delta’s allowed fees;
  • No paperwork for patients to file – dentists submit claims on behalf of the patient;

Delta Dental PPO – a moderately priced plan that covers nearly 4 million people and offers more than 12,200 dentist locations in California and 78,000 dentist locations nationwide. Our PPO plan combines the cost savings of managed care with the flexibility and choice of a fee-for-service plan. This program features:

  • Freedom to visit any licensed dentist (with the greatest cost savings when visiting a PPO network dentist);
  • Comprehensive network of specialists;
  • Unique safety net protection for enrollees who visit any Delta dentist;

What is the “Safety Net?”
Delta’s dental PPO is different from other PPO programs because of our unique safety net – a second network.

Enrollees with Delta’s PPO plan have two dentist networks to choose from: the PPO network for the lowest out-of-pocket costs and the Premier network for managed costs and added conveniences.

  • Delta pays PPO dentists according to fee tables tailored to their practice area. PPO dentists agree to accept these amounts for their PPO patients.
  • Delta Dental Premier dentists (those who participate in the Delta network but who are not PPO dentists) also contract with Delta and agree to Delta’s determination of fees. The PPO patient retains the advantage – or safety net – of limited out-of-pocket costs when visiting these dentists. Premier dentists also complete claims free of charge and handle all paperwork.

DeltaCare – covers 900,000 enrollees in CA and allows enrollees to select a primary care dentist from a convenient network of more than 2,300 dentist locations in CA, including specialists, and 14,000 locations nationwide. DeltaCare’s advantages include:

  • No deductibles
  • Low or no copayments for covered services
  • No annual or lifetime maximums for general services
  • No claim forms
  • Nearly 300 covered procedures
  • Coverage for cosmetic benefits
  • Dental accident coverage
  • Orthodontic takeover provision for enrollees who have started orthodontic treatment under another dental HMO or fee-for-service plan (this extends to a client’s new employees)

Small Business Programs
Our small business portfolio includes all three of our popular products – Delta Dental Premier, Delta Dental PPO and DeltaCare - and is tailored to provide maximum value to small businesses. Programs for employers of 5 to 299 primary enrollees are offered exclusively through selected general agent partners such as Benefitmall. Small businesses can rely on Delta Dental to provide cost containment, comprehensive care and superior access to dentists. No matter which Delta plan they choose, small businesses can feel confident knowing that they have a program that protects their employees and provides their business with tremendous value.

More about Delta Dental
Delta Dental of California, the state’s largest dental health carrier, administers dental benefits that cover nearly 16 million people in our commercial and government programs throughout the nation. In 2000, Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and our affiliate operations joined forces to form a San Francisco-based nonprofit holding company. The partnership, which forms one of the largest dental benefits organizations, was created to improve customer service and expedite technological development. The two companies and subsidiaries and affiliates together serve nearly 19 million enrollees in 16 states and the District of Columbia.

Name: Dental Select
Carrier_Description__c:
Dental Select’s mission is to be the leader in the dental benefits industry by providing unequaled, cost-effective, innovative and flexible plans that exceed customers’ expectations. Dental Select provides exceptional dental benefit solutions.

One dental benefits plan does not fit the needs of every person or business. Dental Select plans are constantly being modified and improved to create innovative new plan designs to fit any company’s specific needs, network or price. All Dental Select products are designed to accept and even encourage change by keeping communication open between all involved parties. At Dental Select, there is no “one idea” or “one plan”. The options are endless. The future plan of Dental Select is to make dental plans more accessible and affordable to the 44% of Americans who don’t currently have dental insurance. Most non-insured people have poor dental health because they fail to get proper dental care. With good, affordable benefits, dental health care will improve throughout the country.  As an added option, Dental Select has recently introduced insured vision and AD&D plans to its dental portfolio in 2005.

It takes more than just the right product and reasonable premiums for Dental Select to deliver the best to its customers. Dental Select also provides unsurpassed service to all of its customers including members, clients and providers. All calls are answered in less than 15 seconds by a Member Service Representative, carefully chosen and thoroughly trained, resulting in courteous and knowledgeable service. We also have highly trained bilingual representatives on staff.

Dental Select also offers fast claims turnaround time and accuracy among the best in the business. Our average claim turnaround time is 5 days with electronic claims processed within 24 hours of receipt. Our members and providers can be assured that their claim is being processed quickly and correctly.

Unlike the traditional insurance industry standard of being slow to adopt technology, Dental Select is driven by technological advances. In order for more individuals and small groups to access dental benefits, Dental Select has been focused on advancing its website www.dentalselect.com. Our website currently offers many online functions such as, online enrollment for Individual Plans, online change form, real time provider search, online provider referral, as well as many other features. The website also hosts a wealth of information for members, future customers, providers and brokers, so their questions are answered quickly and efficiently.  In the near future, Dental Select’s website will offer advanced online functions such as, online enrollment for groups, real-time claims processing, online billing and claims tracking and online quotes.

Dental Select is confident that as they continue on their path to the future, dental benefits will become more accessible and affordable, and that small companies will be able to offer their employees a more comprehensive benefits package.

Because of these exceptional benefit solutions, Dental Select has grown to over 240,000 members, and is the third largest health care provider in Utah. Dental Select has been in the Utah 100 fastest growing companies for the past four years and on the Inc. 500 list of America’s fastest growing companies in 2000.

Dental Select is underwritten by ACE American Insurance Company.

Name: Dominion National
Carrier_Description__c:
Dominion National
www.DominionDental.com 

Dominion National is a leading provider and administrator of dental and vision benefits in the Mid-Atlantic, offering managed care and indemnity programs, claims adjudication and comprehensive plan administration. Among its 550,000 customers are leading health plans, employer groups, municipalities, associations and individuals. 

Dominion National currently maintains active dental networks of over 25,000 dentists in five states and the District of Columbia and also offers access to a national PPO network with over 220,000 dentist listings. The company has the single-largest dental HMO-style network in many Mid-Atlantic markets.1 

Dominion National offers Select dental plans (same as a DHMO),2 PPO plans and dual-choice coverage. Dominion National’s selection of vision plans offers coverage for a wide range of budgets. Plans can be employer-paid or voluntary, custom-tailored for specific needs or simple off-the-shelf products.

Dominion National is Not Just Growing a Company. It is Creating a Movement.

Dominion National was created to fill a void, offering agile and flexible resources to those customers that value innovation, responsiveness and choices.

A refreshing alternative to bureaucratic institutions, Dominion National is a groundbreaker, bringing practical solutions, best practices and a new level of service to the benefits industry. Details are important to Dominion. The company guarantees everything from reporting and billing accuracy to network retention and member satisfaction. No point is too fine.

At Dominion National…We Work For Your Benefit.

Online Resources and Administrative Convenience

Dominion National offers secure online access to comprehensive plan information:  
  • Benefits Administrators can access eligibility records, view bills online, reconcile billing statements, view plan documents, order supplies and print ID cards.
  • Members can view and print plan documents, change dentists (Select Plans only), print ID cards, view and print EOB’s and update contact information.
  • Participating dentists can view benefit plans, check patient eligibility, review claim details and file claims electronically.
A New Level of Service

Dominion National demonstrates a strict commitment to quality care, adherence to the highest ethical standards and constant attention to administrative responsiveness, speed and accuracy. 

In its most recent Member Satisfaction Survey, 96% of the respondents were satisfied with Dominion National as its dental plan.3

Member Service Performance4
  • Less than 0.1% of our members called with a complaint.
  • Call abandonment rate is 0.7%.
  • 95% first call resolution.
  • Response time to website inquiries is within 1 business day.
  • Claims Performance4
  • 99.7% claims accuracy.
  • 98.9% of all claims are processed in fewer than 15 days.
  1. Dominion National Competitive Network Survey, 1st Quarter 2014. Participating dentists are subject to change. Mid-Atlantic includes D.C., Delaware, Maryland, Pennsylvania and Virginia.
  2. There are fixed member copayments, no annual maximum dollar limits, no waiting periods, no deductibles, no pre-authorization paperwork or pre-treatment estimates and no claim forms or proof of loss (except in the case of out-of-area emergencies).
  3. Dominion National Member Satisfaction Survey, January 2014.
  4. Dominion National Internal Performance Report, 2013.

Name: Health Net
Carrier_Description__c:
Health Net is one of the largest publicly traded managed health care companies in the United States. Our corporate mission is simple: to help people be healthy, secure and comfortable. To that end, Health Net provides affordable, high-quality health coverage to more than 11 million consumers with access to a national network of over 490,000 physicians and 4,100 hospitals through our partnership with First Health Network.

Health Net of California, a subsidiary of Health Net, Inc., has more than 2.3 million plan members. Currently, it has one of the largest statewide networks of medical professionals with more than 51,000 physicians, 550 physician groups, over 300 hospitals and more than 4,300 pharmacies. The ancillary statewide network includes over 11,000 providers. The company also offers nationwide access to an extensive network for out-of-state employees.

Health Net of California has over 9,900 employees, a rating of Excellent from the National Committee for Quality Assurance, and is ranked #191 in the list of Top 200 Companies by Fortune Magazine. With a market cap of $6 billion and as a $13 billion national company, Health Net looks forward to continued growth.

Name: GeoBlue
Carrier_Description__c:
INTERNATIONAL MEDICAL INSURANCE
These products cover a variety of needs associated withtraveling and living abroad. They include both short and long-term coverage forgroups and individuals. These products are often used to cover employeesresiding outside of the U.S. or foreign employees working in the U.S.Individual products may also be purchased by those looking for coverage whiletraveling for business or vacationing outside of the U.S.

Both types of coverage can provide benefits such as emergency evacuationand reunion, assistance with language and currency exchange, as well as otherservices that a domestic carrier would have difficulty providing.

Trip cancellation insurance is also available under the HTH brand.

GeoBlue Travel Medical Insurance
Formerly, HTH Worldwide (The HTH brand still operates in some states, such asTexas as product is transitioned to the BLUE), GeoBlue is a specialty insurerand leader in helping world travelers gain access to quality healthcareservices all around the globe. GeoBlue combines a contracted global communityof physicians and hospitals, advanced Internet applications, and wideexperience in international health insurance to ensure customers' health,safety and peace of mind. GeoBlue is the official international travelmedical product for short and long term products for the Blue Cross Blue ShieldAssociation.

Each year hundreds of thousands of leisure and business travelers as wellas international students and scholars protect themselves and their familieswith GeoBlue. Members enjoy access to an elite community of contractedphysicians in more than 190 countries, online physician profiles, medicationdatabases, interactive translation guides for brand name pharmaceuticals andcommon medical terms and phrases, featured articles on dozens of travel-healthtopics and up-to-date health and security news. GeoBlue administers itsinsurance programs and provides exceptional service via its online tools and24/7 toll-free multilingual customer support.

PRODUCTS

  • Xplorer health plans for individuals relocating abroad or leading an international lifestyle
  • Voyageur single trip from 1 to 180 days abroad and Trekker multi-trip for unlimited trips annually under 70 days per trip
  • Student, Missionary and Crew Navigator health insurance designed for both domestic and international needs for these client bases

Carrier_Description__c:
INTERNATIONAL MEDICAL INSURANCE
These products cover a variety of needs associated with traveling and living abroad. They include both short and long-term coverage for groups and individuals. In a group setting, these products are often used to cover employees residing outside of the U.S. or foreign employees working in the U.S. Individual products may be purchased by those looking for coverage while traveling for business or vacationing outside of the U.S.

Both types of coverage can provide benefits such as emergency evacuation and reunion, assistance with language and currency exchange, as well as other services that a domestic carrier would have difficulty providing.

Trip cancellation insurance is also available.

INTERNATIONAL MEDICAL GROUP
International Medical Group, Inc. (IMG) is a worldwide leader in designing, distributing, and administering global healthcare benefits. Since 1990, IMG has provided medical security to thousands of individuals and families in more than 150 countries. These products are underwritten by Sirius International Insurance Corporation – rated A (excellent) by A.M. Best.

Because IMG focuses on the international market, they have the unique ability to offer services that many domestic plans cannot provide. These include:

  • Worldwide claims adjusters, handling most languages and currencies
  • Multilingual claim adjusters and customer service representatives 
  • On-site physicians and registered nurses, available 24 hours a day, seven days a week 
  •  A European service center providing local marketing, administration, and emergency medical assistance 

PRODUCTS
IMG presents a full-service approach to the international community. Clients include international vacationers, business executives and consultants, expatriates, traveling professionals, and local and third country nationals. The IMG portfolio includes a variety of plans covering many needs:

  • Short-term and long-term worldwide medical coverage for individuals and groups
  • Medical coverage in the U.S. for non-Americans and non-Permanent Residents  

The first step to selling with IMG is to complete the Producer Sign-Up.

After registering, you will be assigned an online sales link to enroll clients. Make use of it. Online registrations are the most popular channel for sales.

Carrier_Description__c:
UnitedHealthcare's (www.unitedhealthcare.com) Oxford product portfolio (www.oxfordhealth.com) offers a wide range of affordable and flexible health care plans for businesses and individuals primarily in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.  UnitedHealthcare offers access to quality, affordable health care services contracting directly with more than 560,000 physicians, care professionals, and 4,800 hospitals providing broad, convenient access to services nationwide including Medicare plans, third-party administration of employer-funded benefit plans and multi-site capabilities. The Oxford suite of products includes traditional health maintenance organizations, preferred and exclusive provider organizations, point-of-service plans, and consumer-driven health plans.

Name: Reliance Standard
Carrier_Description__c:
Reliance Standard provides a full spectrum of group coverage to employers as components of basic employee benefits programs. Coverages include group life, group disability income, accidental death and dismemberment, integrated disability, administrative services, group dental and vision. Specialized voluntary coverages are also marketed to employers with enhanced and/or cafeteria employee benefit plans, including an integrated disability income product and an innovative mini-medical product designed for part-time, temporary and seasonal employees. Reliance Standard distributes its products through independent agents and brokers.

Insurance products and services are provided through Reliance Standard Life Insurance Company in all states (except New York), the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico & the U.S. Virgin Islands. Reliance Standard is domiciled in Illinois, and its administrative offices are in Philadelphia.

Reliance Standard has been providing insurance products for over 90 years. It was incorporated in 1907 as the Central Standard Life Insurance Company in Chicago, Illinois. In 1967 the administrative offices moved to Philadelphia, PA and the company was renamed Reliance Standard Life Insurance Company. Not all products are available in all states.

Reliance Standard is owned by Delphi Financial Group (DFG), a publicly traded insurance holding company (NYSE:DFG). DFG is an integrated employee benefit services company and a leader in managing all aspects of employee absence to enhance the productivity of clients.

Other companies in the Delphi Group are:

  • First Reliance Standard Life Insurance Company,(Home Office, New York, N.Y.), a group employee benefits company. FRSL provides insurance products in New York and the District of Columbia.
  • Matrix Absence Management,a service company that manages all programs that make payments to employees for absences, regardless of funding mechanism. Matrix integrates delivery and administration of Disability, Workers Compensation, Return-to-Work services, and Personal/Family Leave of Absence programs into a seamless system.
  • Safety National Casualty Corporation,(Home Office: St. Louis, MO), a Workers’ Compensation specialty insurer offering primary and excess insurance, self-insured bonds and alternative risk funding products and services.

Reliance Standard’s product portfolio includes:

  • Group Term Life/Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance provides death benefits for employees covered under basic employee benefit plans. We offer: accelerated death benefit rider; waiver of premium with Critical Illness benefit; family and medical leave of absence coverage; counseling services; dependent coverage; and supplemental life coverage. A discount is available for employers who maintain a smoke-free workplace and provide wellness programs.
  • Group Disability Income Insurancenot only provides valuable income protection to employees, but also does it at an affordable cost. It can serve as a valuable benefit to help employers retain staff. Our Group Disability Income product has competitive rates and plan design flexibility. Companies can choose from many specially designed benefit packages to offer to their employees. We also offer a competitive “managed disability” program.
  • Group Dental Insuranceprovides benefits for periodic preventive dentistry, extractions, periodontics, endodontics and orthodontia. Plan options vary according to selected coverage. May be sold as stand-alone or with other group coverage. Managed care programs available.
  • Group Vision Insuranceprovides coverage for annual vision exams and benefits for lenses, frames and contacts. Plan options vary according to selected coverage. May be sold as stand-alone or with other group coverage.

RELIANCE STANDARD VOLUNTARY PLANS (RSVP) are 100% employee-paid insurance plans offered at affordable group rates and paid through convenient payroll deduction. Employers can offer voluntary term life, accidental death and dismemberment and integrated short and long term disability insurance in any combination to their employees. The employer chooses and designs a plan that’s right for their employees.

  • Voluntary Term Life Insurance offers term life insurance to employees and dependents. Tobacco user/non-tobacco user rates are available.
  • Voluntary Group Disability Income Insurance offers integrated short term and long term disability, and features flexible elimination periods and maximums.
  • Voluntary Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance offers employees an opportunity to purchase valuable Accidental Death and Dismemberment insurance for themselves and their dependents on a payroll deduction basis. Seat belt/air bag benefit is available up to $100,000 maximum.
  • Voluntary Dental and Vision Plans, called Flex Plans, may be designed for use with Section 125 of the Internal Revenue Service code and allow employees to pay for benefits with pre-tax dollars.

RSL BasicCare™ is available for hourly, part-time, seasonal, temporary, or irregularly scheduled employees in certain occupations. RSL Basic Care is a portfolio of limited, voluntary group health plans that offer affordable coverage to employees with no access to employer-paid health benefits. Flexible medical plans, including hospitalization and prescription benefits, are complemented by ancillary coverages such as Basic Care Dental, Basic Care Term Life and Basic Care STD.

RSL SmartChoice™, our Small Group product offers flexible LTD, Life/AD&D, STD, Dental and Vision plans with competitive rates and flexible plan designs. For groups with 2 to 19 lives (except dental/vision). Coverages include:

  • SmartChoice LTD
  • SmartChoice STD
  • SmartChoice Term Life
  • SmartChoice AD&D
  • SmartChoice Dental and Vision (3-19 lives)

Absence Solutions®, the integrated employee benefits platform marketed exclusively by Reliance Standard and sister company Matrix Absence Management, based in San Jose, CA. Absence Solutions® integrates short and/or long term disability coverage with sophisticated leave management, clinical case management, administrative and reporting features, and is an industry leader in helping companies manage FMLA leave, and quantify their return on investment. Effective absence management requires skill sets that most companies simply don’t have in-house. That’s why so many leading-edge companies choose to outsource this vital business process to an integrated employee benefit company whose core competencies are disability insurance, workers’ compensation insurance and comprehensive absence management: Delphi Financial Group.

Business Travel Accident can be written for groups of five or more. If the state minimum requirement is greater than five, the group must meet the state’s minimum requirements. The amount and kind of business traveling done by key employees influences the kind of plan needed. Tailored plans are available upon request.
