Name: Sun Life Financial
Carrier_Description__c:
Strengthen your benefit lineup with Stop-Loss from Sun Life Financial.

If you’re one of the many employers who have opted to self-insure your employees’ health benefits, you know that self-funding gives you more control over the coverage you offer to your employees, plus the opportunity to reduce costs.

Stop-Loss insurance is a critical part of any self-funded benefits plan. Without it, an unanticipated claim can become a catastrophe for your business. With it, you protect your claims-paying ability for your employees—and your firm’s cash flow.

So, how to choose the right Stop-Loss policy for your benefits lineup? At a minimum, your Stop-Loss provider should offer reasonable rates, efficient service, and the resources to pay even the largest of claims quickly.

  • Count on Sun Life Financial for reliable protection from one of the largest Stop-Loss providers in the country.

  • Partner with Sun Life Financial for helpful and predictable service.

  • Grow with Sun Life Financial through money-saving resources and flexible coverage.

At Sun Life Financial, they have the size, strength, and expertise to do all of this—and more. When you choose Sun Life Financial, you’ll see why they have become a leader in the Stop-Loss industry.

For more information on the Stop-Loss products offered by Sun Life Financial, please contact your BenefitMall Self-Funded Division Team.

©2010 Sun Life Assurance Company of Canada, Wellesley Hills, MA 02481. All rights reserved. Sun Life Financial and the globe symbol are registered trademarks of Sun Life Assurance Company of Canada. Visit us at www.sunlife.com/us.

Name: Superior Vision
Carrier_Description__c:
Superior Vision is a leader in the managed vision care market, focused on delivering choice and flexibility to our customers and members.  Vision benefits is all that we do, and our customer-centric philosophy delivers distinctive service, operational excellence, and unparalleled provider access points.  Our goal is to deliver the best eye and vision health solution to our customers, and help them create active consumers who make the most informed decisions about their vision.  Comprehensive eye exams can be early identifiers for both ocular and systemic diseases, and utilization of vision benefits creates a healthier, more productive workforce.

Studies show that nearly 50% of consumers choose to utilize retail optical chains to receive their materials, so the breadth and depth of our provider network translates into choice, quality, and accessibility for members.  Members may go to one provider for their exam and another for their glasses or contacts. 

Our stand-alone vision plans include fully-insured, Exam-only, and Materials-only, for both voluntary and employer-paid plans.  With competitively priced rates, we ultimately provide the lowest out-of-pockets costs as members are in control of choosing the provider who best matches their delivery and budget preferences.

For more information on Superior Vision, please contact your local BenefitMall sales team.

Name: The Hartford
Carrier_Description__c:
The Hartford is a Powerful Partner Working for You!
Your business is unique. So you should have choices to meet your distinct needs. With The Hartford,1 you can select from a wide array of group life, disability and related product and service options to help you maintain your productivity while protecting your employees.

Long-Term Disability (LTD)

  • Contract provisions that provide return-to-work incentives
  • Claim management that focuses on an employee’s abilities, not limitations
  • An independent physician review model helps ensure more fair, objective claim decisions
  • No self-reported condition limitations or prudent person language in our contract
  • Easy integration with our Short-Term Disability (STD) insurance, Family Medical Leave Act (FMLA) administration, and Workers’ Compensation (WC) programs
  • Flexible benefit features include Family Care Expense Credit, Workplace Modification Benefit and Extended Earnings Protection Benefit
  • Core buy-up plans available
  • Ability Assist® provides support to insured employees, claimants and their family members through ComPsych.® There is no additional cost for insured employee coverage up to 1,000 lives. For cases over 1,000 lives, an additional charge will apply.

Short-Term Disability (STD)

  • Contract provisions that provide return-to-work incentives

Name: Ceridian
Carrier_Description__c:
BENEFITS ADMINISTRATION SERVICES
The federal government has multiple laws affecting the way employers and individuals access and pay for benefits. Their complexity and continual modification make outsourcing the administration of these services a simple decision

Tax-Qualified Plans
Legislation allows the use of pre-tax dollars by employers and employees to fund benefits. Groups that maximize their use of such tools see significant savings and bring significant additional benefits to their employees. Sometimes, the benefits to the employees are savings, too.

COBRA
The Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 is a federal law that outlines the rights of qualified individuals and their dependents to retain healthcare coverage after job loss and other changes in circumstance, and the portability of those benefits to new healthcare providers. COBRA applies to employers who have 20 or more employees and who offer group health coverage. COBRA services handle the integration, administration, and management of COBRA requirements set forth by the federal government for businesses offering healthcare benefits.

The complexity and liability associated with incorrectly processing COBRA continues to increase. As such, many employers and brokers are looking for a dedicated company where they can outsource these services.

CERIDIAN
Ceridian is a global business services company that offers a comprehensive range of innovative solutions. From human resources and benefits to work-life and health and productivity services, they help organizations maximize their human, financial and technology resources.

As the nation’s largest COBRA/HIPAA Administrator, you can confidently refer your clients to Ceridian. Their human resource solutions are designed to help companies more easily and effectively manage their workforce and the information integral to HR processes while reducing costs and enabling them to focus on their core businesses.

PRODUCTS

Tax-Qualified Plans

A low-cost option for the self-serve client is a product called FSA123.  There are also a couple other full-service options for FSA services from Ceridian. For a brief explanation of their full-service product and their special pricing offer for BenefitMall brokers, click here.

COBRA/HIPAA Administration
View an update on the American Recovery & Reinvestment Act of 2009 (ARRA).

To help you and your client decide whether outsourcing these services is appropriate, study the COBRA Checklist.

See the COBRA Brochure for the list of services and special pricing available to BenefitMall brokers.

For further product support, contact Ceridian at 1-800-790-9057 x8791, study them at www.ceridian.com, or contact your Sales Representative.

Human Resource/Benefits Compliance Solutions
HRComply is the broadest, clearest, most reliable resource available to help human resource administrators protect their organizations and themselves from the risk of costly litigation inherent in today’s maze of complex employment laws. As your clients look to you for guidance, provide them with the one sure source they need to navigate the complexities of current and future workplace regulations quickly, confidently … and correctly.

These links will take to you the HRComply product overview, employer brochure and application, and HRComply client testimonials.

Name: Anthem
Carrier_Description__c:
Background
Since its founding over 65 years ago, the company has grown into a leading provider of health plans and benefit services under the respected Blue Cross® and Blue Shield® brands. The Blues have been a historical leader in its markets and one of the oldest health plans serving the Rocky Mountain Region. The company provides health coverage to more than one million people in Colorado and Nevada through its Preferred Provider Organization (PPO), Health Maintenance Organization (HMO), Point of Service (POS) and Indemnity health plans. The mission of Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield is “To improve the health of the people we serve.”

Premier Benefits and the Nation’s Largest Network
Convenience, access, seamless administration — what your employees want, they get with Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield’s PPO health benefit program. Because Anthem is a member of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association,* Anthem PPO members access care through the BlueCard® program. That means a dedicated claims processing system and a cross-country network linking 90 percent of doctors and 80 percent of hospitals in America. 

Corporate Alliance
Anthem’s parent company is an Indiana-domiciled publicly traded company that, through its subsidiary companies, provides health care benefits and services to approximately 28 million people. Anthem’s parent company, which is based in Indianapolis, is the Blue Cross licensee in California and the Blue Cross and Blue Shield licensee in 12 other states:  Colorado, Connecticut Georgia, Indiana, Kentucky, Maine, Missouri (excluding 30 counties in the Kansas City area), Nevada, New Hampshire, Ohio, and Virginia (excluding the immediate suburbs of Washington, D.C. More information about Anthem is available at www.anthem.com.

Anthem Overview
Anthem evolved in the mid 1990’s following the merger of The Associated Group of Kentucky and Indiana, and the Community Mutual Insurance Company in Ohio. This merger was the nation's first multi-state integrated health care system. In late 1997, the company established a second operating region, Anthem East, when it acquired Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Connecticut. In 1999, Anthem strengthened its presence in this region by announcing its intent to purchase Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Maine and completing the acquisition of Blue Cross and Blue Shield of New Hampshire in October. A month later, Anthem added Blue Cross Blue Shield of Colorado and Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nevada, thereby establishing Anthem’s third operating region known as Anthem West. On July 31, 2002, Anthem completed the merger with Trigon Blue Cross and Blue Shield in Virginia, establishing a Southeast operating region. On November 30, 2004, Anthem, Inc. merged with the parent company of Blue Cross of California, making the combined companies the largest health coverage carrier in the United States.

Managed care continues to increase in importance in health care today. Anthem’s managed care mission is quite clear. As a manager of health care networks, Anthem pursues partnerships with leading physicians and hospitals, while striving for continual quality improvement through clinical management and the collection, interpretation and sharing of accurate information with providers and customers. Anthem’s strategy of building partnerships with exceptional physicians and hospitals allows it to deliver consistent quality and cost management to employers within Anthem’s service areas. Anthem’s affiliation with Blue Cross and Blue Shield Plans nationally gives it the ability to serve employees outside the region served by Anthem.

Financial Stability
Anthem’s parent company is a Fortune 500 company. The insurance industry’s most respected rating agencies continue to recognize Anthem’s financial strength.

AM Best = A              

Fitch = AA-                  

Standard & Poors = A  

Moody's = A1        

NCQA Accreditation
In September 2004, Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield; subsidiary company, HMO Colorado, Inc., once again earned an Excellent accreditation status – the highest level awarded – from the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA). The NCQA Excellent rating applies to the health maintenance organization (HMO) and point-of-service (POS) plans in Colorado. This designation signifies that HMO Colorado’s performance meets the most stringent quality standards in the industry. In December 2004, Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield became URAC accredited in Utilization Management for its HMO and PPO operations in Colorado and Nevada.

Customer Choice
Employers look to the company and its subsidiaries for choices that meet varied and unique needs:

Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) HMO Colorado provides two delivery systems connecting its provider network to members. The first is through Primary Care Physicians (PCPs) who contract directly. Though the HMO network is open access, these PCPs still manage a member’s care.

Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) PPO’s give cost-effective choices from one of the largest provider networks in the Colorado offering the member choice. The PPO is a non-gatekeeper product.

Indemnity Coverage Some customers still look for traditional health coverage. At Anthem, traditional coverage has always been delivered through a broad network of participating physicians, hospitals and other providers.

Administrative Services Many customers look to Anthem for efficient, flexible and reliable administrative support of benefit plans that are underwritten and financed by major purchasers. These include, but not limited to, dental, disability or workers’ compensation coverage.

Individual Plans Anthem also serves individuals and others not covered by employer groups in Colorado. One of the most successful is the health-care coverage the company provides to children who do not receive cost-effective coverage under their parents or guardians health plans. The Blues brand symbolizes security for many of the people purchasing individual coverage.

Comprehensive Solutions Finally, with an already-broad product mix, the company can tailor its offerings to meet unique needs. It can analyze a customer’s benefit requirements and offer a comprehensive solution. For example, Anthem can coordinate HMO and POS health plans with disability coverage to give an affordable and complete solution. As the company marshals the varied elements of its product mix, and as it delivers customized solutions, Anthem has become a better partner to customers. In all markets, the Blues brand is a competitive advantage.

Ancillary Products
The most trusted name in health care also offers dental coverage, plus a full range of term life, disability and voluntary insurance products, flexible benefit plans and third party claims administration to complete your benefits package.

Anthem Dental
Anthem Dental offers a statewide dental plan in both Colorado and Nevada. Anthem Dental has placed a strong emphasis on the creating a strong and stable provider network with flexible benefit designs to meet the client’s needs. Additional information is available on the Anthem website at www.anthem.com. 

Term Life, Disability and AD&D Products
Anthem Life, a subsidiary of Anthem, has been serving policyholders for 25 years.

  • Group Term Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance
  • Short-term Disability Insurance
  • Long-term Disability Insurance 

Voluntary Group Products
A voluntary insurance program from Anthem Life gives employees access to a customized life and disability package through convenient payroll deductions, with no added premium cost to your company.

  • Voluntary Group Term Life Insurance
  • Voluntary Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance
  • Voluntary Short-term Disability Insurance 

Flexible Benefit Plans
Anthem has formed a strategic relationship with FlexBen Corporation for the provision of IRS Section 125 Flexible Benefit plan services to its own employees and its clients. FlexBen Corporation is the nation's leading independent provider of Flexible Benefit plan consulting, administration and related services.

Benefit plans offered by FlexBen include:

  • Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare and Dependent Care Reimbursement)
  • Premium Conversion Plans
  • Cafeteria Plans

Anthem Vision
Anthem now offers a more comprehensive vision product to meet the needs of today’s client. The vision product offers an array of benefits with different copays and co-insurance. Below are some highlights of the new vision product:

  • A national network of 24,000 providers, including all LensCrafters locations.
  • Competitive premiums at least 10 percent lower than our competitors’
  • Benefit design options to meet the needs of the small or large group client including fully insured, self-funded or voluntary plan
  • Preferred pricing for eyewear, contact lenses and more

Anthem Healthy Solutions
Anthem Health Solutions is a series of programs designed to support informed patient decision making, maintain healthcare costs, and collaborate with hospitals and physicians to improve the quality and safety of healthcare. It includes a wide variety of programs and services designed to keep your employees healthy and productive through:

  • Informed Solutions – resources that educate and empower through resources such as Anthem.com
  • Guided Solutions – pointing your employees who may need a little extra support toward better health such as disease management and health education programs
  • Targeted Solutions – programs designed to take aim at serious health conditions by providing added support to those who need it.

Online Capabilities
Anthem’s website is an integral part of Anthem’s Health Solutions. The anthem website offers member utilities, and a variety or programs and services that educate and inform. Anthem.com has all the basics that members need, such as products, services and contact information, while offering 24/7 access to personalized plan information and self-service tools.

Members have a wealth of information available at anthem.com.

MyAnthem, a personalized member website link allows members to choose/change PCPs, check claims status, visit the Online Pharmacy to refill prescriptions, request a replacement ID card, search for a provider and obtain driving directions to that provider location, and select hospitals based on reputation or clinical outcomes.

Anthem has added MyHealth@Anthem, which supplies members with personalized health information, self-care centers and health management tools.

SpecialOffers@Anthem is a discount program that offers employees impressive savings on health-related products and services.
 
Members can also email customer service through the Anthem website at anthem.com.

Name: Delta Dental (via Morgan White Group, Inc.)
DentaQuest
Carrier_Description__c:
As an industry leader with more than three decades of dental benefits experience, DentaQuest administers government and commercial dental programs that serve more than nine million members. At DentaQuest, we believe that the key to improving oral health is to increase access to quality preventive care and treatments. This means that 100% of our focus is dedicated to delivering great dental plans.

DentaQuest has one of the broadest and deepest product lines of any dental insurance carrier in the region. Whether you are looking for a national or regional PPO plan, a cost effective DHMO plan, or a traditional indemnity plan, we have you covered. Our large dentist networks, affordable premiums and flexible plan designs assure that your experience with DentaQuest will be a pleasant one. We even guarantee your satisfaction in writing.

DentaQuest provides dental benefits programs for employers, unions, and associations located in Maryland and Washington, D.C. through DentaQuest Mid-Atlantic, Inc., and in Virginia through DentaQuest Virginia, Inc. We offer a full spectrum of dental plans that emphasize preventive dentistry and encourage dentists to work together with their patients to achieve optimum oral health.

Our product offerings include managed care dental plans (DHMO), preferred provider organization plans (PPO), traditional indemnity plans, and administrative service only plans (ASO). We also offer a number of voluntary plans that allow employers to offer dental benefits to employees without any cost to them. Please visit our Web site at www.dentaquest.com to learn more about our innovative line of dental insurance plans.

At DentaQuest, we have a passion for teeth—and it shows in everything we do.

Name: Health Advocate
Carrier_Description__c:
CLIENT ADVOCACY SUPPORT

The healthcare industry is complicated. What’s worse is the emotional, financial and health issues that an individual must deal with at the same time they need to interact with their insurance companies. This is often when brokers are called in to help. Companies are going to fill this unique need of supporting people, regardless of which insurance company they are utilizing. 

A COMPLETE SPECTRUM OF BUSINESS SOLUTIONS

No matter what your needs, Health Advocate has the right experts and solutions to save time and money, increase productivity and maximize benefits.

HEALTH ADVOCATE

Meeting your every healthcare need is our business. We leverage our broad-based experience in navigating healthcare to bring you a spectrum of solutions that get results. Starting with Health Advocacy and adding one or more of our fully integrated solutions means your employees have unlimited access to personalized healthcare and complete support.

HEALTH ADVOCACY

Our Personal Health Advocates, typically registered nurses supported by medical directors, benefits and claims specialists, work on an employee’s behalf to resolve a range of clinical, administrative and insurance-related issues that can overburden employees, your HR staff and brokers. Personal Health Advocates remain with the employee or member until the issue is resolved. They are also available to assist the employee, their spouse, dependent children, parents and parents-in-law in the following areas:

  • Clinical Support. Finds doctors; obtains second opinions; researches treatments; schedules appointments with specialists 

  • Administrative Support. Helps resolve insurance claims; correct billing mistakes; provide healthcare estimates; negotiate billing and payment arrangements; navigate within an insurance company 

  • Healthcare Coaching. Prepares employees for doctor visits; informs about medical tests and treatments; explains complex conditions 

  • Information and Resource Support. Assists with eldercare; Medicare issues; explains benefits; researches transportation  

  • Health Cost Estimator. Our pricing transparency tool provides employees with accurate cost estimates and hospital safety scores for medical procedures in their area. This gives your employees the information they need to be true "healthcare consumers." Health Cost Estimator can be accessed by calling Health Advocate, through the member website, or by downloading the free Health Cost Estimator app from iTunes or Google Play.

  • Help for Seniors. Assists with transitioning to Medicare; locates assisted living and eldercare services

EmpoweredHealth™

Access to Health Advocacy, Wellness Coaching, EAP+Work/Life, Nurseline, Chronic Care Solutions, Personalized Health Communications, and more in one fully integrated solution.  EmpoweredHealth is available to self-insured groups over 250 lives only.

Wellness Coaching 

Comprehensive, convenient program designed to help employees improve and maintain their health through personalized coaching. The service includes unlimited wellness coaching, an online Health Risk Assessment, interactive wellness programs, a comprehensive wellness website, management reports, medical decision support, and more.

EAP+Work/Life™ Program

EAP professionals provide short-term counseling and resource support for personal, family and work/life issues, as well as assist HR staff with sensitive issues.

Medical Bill Saver

Offers employees financial relief through bill negotiation on balance bills resulting from claims on non-covered, out-of-network services, or when an employee hits a benefit maximum.

MedChoice™ Support

This interactive, online tool helps employees make cost-effective decisions and understand their options about medical care.

NurseLine™

24/7 unlimited access to registered nurses for advice on non-urgent medical conditions, referral and self-care information.

Health Information Dashboard

Created for each employee, the Health Information Dashboard spotlights overdue health screenings and tests, highlights provider contact information, provides health tips, easily identifies areas for improvement and leverages teachable moments for better health outcomes.

Biometric Screening™ 

Nationwide program offers a full range of onsite health screening options and immunizations. 

Tobacco Cessation™ 

A 12-week program that helps employees become, and stay, tobacco-free.

TURNKEY COMMUNICATIONS

Health Advocate provides a comprehensive, turnkey communications package to promote employee awareness and utilization of our services.

Health Advocate is not affiliated with any insurance or third party provider. Health Advocate does not replace health insurance coverage, provide medical care or recommend treatment.

Name: Ameriflex
Carrier_Description__c:
BENEFITS ADMINISTRATION SERVICES

The federal government has multiple laws affecting the way employers and individuals access and pay for benefits. Their complexity and continual modification make outsourcing the administration of these services a simple decision

Tax-Qualified Plans

Legislation allows the use of pre-tax dollars by employers and employees to fund benefits. Groups that maximize their use of such tools see significant savings and bring significant additional benefits to their employees. Sometimes, the benefits to the employees are savings, too. 

COBRA

The Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 is a federal law that outlines the rights of qualified individuals and their dependents to retain healthcare coverage after job loss and other changes in circumstance, and the portability of those benefits to new healthcare providers. COBRA applies to employers who have 20 or more employees and who offer group health coverage. COBRA services handle the integration, administration, and management of COBRA requirements set forth by the federal government for businesses offering healthcare benefits.

The complexity and liability associated with incorrectly processing COBRA continues to increase. As such, many employers and brokers are looking for a dedicated company where they can outsource these services. 

AMERIFLEX

Established as a third-party administrator in 1998, AmeriFlex is an independent benefits administrator providing technology-based, consumer-driven benefits and compliance solutions to clients throughout the United States. AmeriFlex is headquartered in Mount Laurel, N.J., and serves more than 5,200 clients that represent over 2,200,000 employees.

AmeriFlex’s commitment to innovative technology delivers a wealth of consumer-driven benefit options, as well as a robust, web-based COBRA administration system. These turnkey solutions provide our clients with the ability to remain strategically competitive in the ever-changing landscape of employee benefits, consumer-driven healthcare and compliance.

In 1999, AmeriFlex and our banking intermediary, Metavante, helped pioneer the FSA debit card. As a result, AmeriFlex gained immediate and substantial market share and used this momentum to further enhance our technological capabilities, including the development of a consolidated debit card platform combining FSA, HRA, HSA, and CRA into one debit card, the AmeriFlex Convenience Card®. This singular approach provides simplification and ease of use for both employer and employee. The employer is rewarded with the savings derived from per participant rather than per account pricing, as well as real-time balances and user-friendly consolidated reporting. The employee is unencumbered with the confusion and frustration inherent in the understanding and use of multiple cards. Many TPAs who were late adopters of debit card technology continue to face the obstacles associated with dual processing platforms and data interface challenges. Ten years of refining the AmeriFlex Convenience Card® system have allowed us to take full advantage of the potential inherent in this technology.  

The power and simplicity of the complete AmeriFlex suite of services with particular emphasis on our utilization of a single debit card platform and web-based COBRA administration have positioned AmeriFlex as the industry leader.  

PRODUCTS

Eight years of experience refining the FSA debit card system has positioned AmeriFlex as an industry leader in providing technology-based, consumer-driven benefit solutions. We offer compelling advantages to employers and employees with our efficient, progressive delivery of a consolidated FSA/HRA/HSA/CRA debit card platform—the AmeriFlex Convenience Card®, the core of our total consumer-driven benefit solution. 

The Mongoose® COBRA/HIPPA services delivers a unique strategy for attacking and eliminating the complexities of COBRA/HIPAA administration and compliance. Mongoose® shifts an employer's COBRA liability AND the personal liability of the internal plan administrator to AmeriFlex.

Priority Services Include:

  • AmeriFlex Convenience Card®
  • Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
  • Healthcare Reimbursement Accounts (HRA)
  • Health Savings Accounts (HSA)
  • Commuter Reimbursement Accounts (CRA)
  • Mongoose® COBRA/HIPAA Administration 

For further product support, study www.flex125.com, or contact your BenefitMall Sales Representative.
